gospel.text:
[[Lc 11,27]]While Jesus was speaking, a woman from the crowd called out and said to him, "Blessed is the womb that carried you and the breasts at which you nursed."
[[Lc 11,28]]He replied, "Rather, blessed are those who hear the word of God and observe it."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.text:
[[Ps 105,2]]Sing to him, sing his praise, 
proclaim all his wondrous deeds.
[[Ps 105,3]]Glory in his holy name; 
rejoice, O hearts that seek the LORD!

[[Ps 105,4]]Look to the LORD in his strength; 
seek to serve him constantly.
[[Ps 105,5]]Recall the wondrous deeds that he has wrought, 
his portents, and the judgments he has uttered.

[[Ps 105,6]]You descendants of Abraham, his servants, 
sons of Jacob, his chosen ones!
[[Ps 105,7]]He, the LORD, is our God; 
throughout the earth his judgments prevail.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Ga 3,22]]Brothers and sisters: Scripture confined all things under the power of sin, that through faith in Jesus Christ the promise might be given to those who believe.
[[Ga 3,23]]Before faith came, we were held in custody under law, confined for the faith that was to be revealed.
[[Ga 3,24]]Consequently, the law was our disciplinarian for Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
[[Ga 3,25]]But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a disciplinarian.
[[Ga 3,26]]For through faith you are all children of God in Christ Jesus.
[[Ga 3,27]]For all of you who were baptized into Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ.
[[Ga 3,28]]There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free person, there is not male and female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus.
[[Ga 3,29]]And if you belong to Christ, then you are Abraham's descendant, heirs according to the promise.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Galatians
